729795f-a.title: Richmond: Vanderbilt Avenue - Tompkins Avenue
729795f-a.text:
Vanderbilt Avenue (right), at the N.E. corner of
Tompkins Avenue, snowing a 2 - story frame dwelling on the
former George W. Vanderbilt estate.
February 25, 1931
P. L. Sperr
NO REPODUCTIONS
729795f-a.folder: Vanderbilt Avenue & Tompkins Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729749f-a.title: Richmond: Tompkins Avenue - Vanderbilt Avenue
729749f-a.text:
(1)
119 Tompkins Avenue, east side, north of
Vanderbilt Avenue, showing the Mariners' Family Asylum.'
The view is across a clearance on the west side of the Avenuue.
January 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
A rear view, seen from the U. S. Marine Hospital
grounds.
January 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr

729764f-a.title: Richmond: Tompkins Avenue - Vanderbilt Avenue
729764f-a.text:
Tompkins Avenue (right to left), at the intersection
of Vanderbilt Avenue. The view is northeastward and shows,
in the center, the old Gerge W. Vanderbilt estate and house,
at the N .E. corner of the two thoroug.ifares.
February 25, 1931
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729764f-a.folder: Tompkins Avenue & Vanderbilt Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729794f-c.title: Richmond: Vanderbilt Avenue - Tompkins Avenue
729794f-c.text:
Vanderbilt Avenue, at the N.E. corner of Tompkins
Avenue, showing the former Geo. W. Vanderbilt estate. The
house in the background is the Mariners' Family AsyldM,
119 Tompkins Avenue.
February 25, 19S1
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
The rear of the house, seen from the new site of the
U. S. Marine Hospital.
June 7,1931
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(3)
Another rear view.
Juno 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr
No REPRODUCTIONS
